result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas James Kent was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Intent to Certify Debt to DOR

4:05 PM Case called. Defendant Nicholas James Kent in court with attorney Christian J Ness.  Defendant Nicholas James Kent in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets record.  PLQ filed. State requests 12 month sentence, with credit for 194 days. State argues for sentence.  Atty Ness argues for a sentence of 9 months. DEF addresses Court. Court addresses parties.
Court sentences DEF to 11 months county jail with credit for 194 days served. Huber priviledges.      Convert from DOC Collect to Clerk of Courts Collect - owes costs, fines or restitution

Defendant Nicholas James Kent in court, in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Warrant quashed.  Court questions defendant.  Court advised the defendant to contact the public defenders office.  Court advised him as to his right to a prelimin w/i 10 days.  Defendant wishes to have the hearing w/i 10 days.
